Both are among the distinguished ones from the companions of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ from the people of Badr. Learn from them and follow their example. I have made Abdullah ibn Mas'ud the treasurer of your wealth. I have preferred you with Abdullah ibn Mas'ud over myself. hadiths.english_translation: Narrated that Umar ibn al-Khattab wrote to the people of Kufa, and Waki' says in his narration: His letter was read to us: As for what follows, I have sent to you Ammar ibn Yasir as governor and Ibn Mas'ud. Waki' said: as teacher and minister. Abu Nu'aym and Qabisah said: as educator and minister. Both are among the distinguished from the companions of Muhammad ﷺ from the people of Badr. Follow their example and listen to their words. I have given you preference with Abdullah over myself. Waki' added: I have made Ibn Mas'ud the treasurer of your wealth and sent Uthman ibn Hunayf over the territory. I give them provisions daily - half and the organs for Ammar ibn Yasir and the remaining half among these. Also, Qabisah ibn Uqbah narrated: Sufyan narrated from al-Ajlah or someone else from Abdullah ibn Abi al-Hudhayl: That Umar gave provisions to Ammar, Abdullah ibn Mas'ud, and Uthman ibn Hunayf daily - for Ammar half and the organs, for Abdullah a quarter, and for Uthman a quarter every day.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Muhammad (ibn Sirin): The companions of Abdullah ibn Mas'ud were five. Some of them would put Ubaidah first, and some would put Alqamah first, but they did not differ that Shuraih was the last of them.
